title: Genesis Quiz - Complete Book
description: Test your comprehensive knowledge of the entire book of Genesis with 25 questions covering key events, people, and teachings from all 50 chapters.

questions.question: Who created the heaven and the earth?
questions.explanation: Genesis 1:1 states that God created the heaven and the earth in the beginning.

questions.question: On which day did God create light?
questions.explanation: God said, 'Let there be light,' and it was so on the first day.

questions.question: According to Genesis 1:27, in whose image was man created?
questions.explanation: Man was created in the image of God, male and female.

questions.question: What command did God give to Adam and Eve regarding the fruit of the tree of knowledge?
questions.explanation: God commanded Adam that he should not eat of the tree of knowledge of good and evil.

questions.question: What was the serpent's role in the Garden of Eden?
options: Tempted Eve to eat the forbidden fruit
questions.correctAnswer: Tempted Eve to eat the forbidden fruit
questions.explanation: The serpent deceived Eve to eat the fruit from the tree of knowledge.

questions.question: What punishment did God give to Eve after the fall?
questions.explanation: God said to Eve, 'I will greatly multiply thy sorrow and thy conception; in sorrow thou shalt bring forth children.'

questions.question: True or False: Cain killed his brother Abel out of jealousy.
questions.explanation: Cain killed Abel because God accepted Abel's offering but not his.

questions.question: Who was the first man to build a city according to Genesis?
questions.explanation: Cain built a city and named it after his son Enoch.

questions.question: How long did Methuselah live according to the genealogy in Genesis?
questions.explanation: Methuselah lived 969 years, the longest recorded in the Bible.

questions.question: What was the reason God decided to destroy the earth with a flood?
options: The earth was corrupt and full of violence
The earth was dry and barren
questions.correctAnswer: The earth was corrupt and full of violence
questions.explanation: God saw that the wickedness of man was great and that every imagination of the thoughts of his heart was only evil continually.

questions.question: True or False: Noah took seven pairs of every clean animal onto the ark.
questions.explanation: Noah was commanded to take seven pairs of every clean animal and one pair of every unclean animal.

questions.question: How long did the floodwaters prevail on the earth?
questions.explanation: The waters prevailed upon the earth 150 days before they began to recede.

questions.question: What sign did God give Noah as a covenant that He would never again destroy the earth by flood?
questions.explanation: God set the rainbow in the cloud as a token of the everlasting covenant.

questions.question: Who was the father of Abram (Abraham)?
questions.explanation: Terah was the father of Abram, Nahor, and Haran.

questions.question: True or False: Abram was called by God to leave his country and go to a land that God would show him.
questions.explanation: God commanded Abram to leave his country and go to the land He would show him.

questions.question: What was the name of Abram's wife?
questions.explanation: Abram's wife was named Sarai, later renamed Sarah by God.

questions.question: What did Abram do when he arrived in the land of Canaan?
options: Built an altar and called on the name of the LORD
questions.correctAnswer: Built an altar and called on the name of the LORD
questions.explanation: Abram built an altar to the LORD in Canaan and called upon His name.

questions.question: True or False: Abram lied about Sarai being his sister to Pharaoh in Egypt.
questions.explanation: Abram said Sarai was his sister, and Pharaoh took her into his house.

questions.question: Who was Lot in relation to Abram?
questions.explanation: Lot was the son of Haran, Abram's brother, making him Abram's nephew.

questions.question: Why did Abram and Lot separate?
options: Their herdsmen quarreled and the land could not support both
They wanted to explore new lands
questions.correctAnswer: Their herdsmen quarreled and the land could not support both
questions.explanation: The land could not bear them dwelling together because their substance was great and their herdsmen quarreled.

questions.question: Which land did Lot choose when he separated from Abram?
questions.explanation: Lot chose all the plain of Jordan, which was well watered like the garden of the LORD.

questions.question: True or False: God promised Abram that his seed would be as the dust of the earth and inherit the land he saw.
questions.explanation: God promised Abram that his seed would be numerous as the dust and inherit the land.

questions.question: What covenant did God establish with Abram in Genesis 15?
options: He promised Abram numerous descendants and the land from the river of Egypt to the Euphrates
He promised Abram wealth and kingship
He promised Abram immediate victory over enemies
questions.correctAnswer: He promised Abram numerous descendants and the land from the river of Egypt to the Euphrates
questions.explanation: God made a covenant promising Abram heirs as numerous as the stars and the land from the river of Egypt to Euphrates.

questions.question: What was the original name of Abraham's wife before God changed it?
questions.explanation: Sarai was renamed Sarah by God as part of the covenant.

questions.question: True or False: Abraham laughed when God told him Sarah would bear a son.
questions.explanation: Abraham laughed at the idea of having a son by Sarah in their old age.

questions.question: What was the name of Abraham and Sarah's son?
questions.explanation: God promised Abraham and Sarah a son named Isaac.

questions.question: Who was Hagar in relation to Abraham?
options: Sarah’s handmaid and mother of Ishmael
questions.correctAnswer: Sarah’s handmaid and mother of Ishmael
questions.explanation: Hagar was Sarah’s Egyptian handmaid who bore Ishmael to Abraham.

questions.question: True or False: Ishmael was the son of Abraham and Hagar.
questions.explanation: Ishmael was born to Abraham and Hagar.

questions.question: What test did God give Abraham involving his son Isaac?
options: To offer Isaac as a burnt offering
To build an altar with Isaac
questions.correctAnswer: To offer Isaac as a burnt offering
questions.explanation: God asked Abraham to offer Isaac as a burnt offering, testing his faith.

questions.question: True or False: Abraham obeyed God and was willing to sacrifice Isaac.
questions.explanation: Abraham showed obedience by preparing to sacrifice Isaac as God commanded.

questions.question: Who was Isaac's wife?
questions.explanation: Isaac married Rebekah, the daughter of Bethuel.

questions.question: How were Esau and Jacob related?
questions.explanation: Esau and Jacob were twin brothers born to Isaac and Rebekah.

questions.question: True or False: Esau sold his birthright to Jacob for a meal of lentils.
questions.explanation: Esau despised his birthright and sold it to Jacob for food.

questions.question: What was Jacob's dream at Bethel?
options: A ladder reaching to heaven with angels ascending and descending
questions.correctAnswer: A ladder reaching to heaven with angels ascending and descending
questions.explanation: Jacob dreamed of a ladder set up on earth reaching to heaven with angels.

questions.question: Who did Jacob work for to marry Rachel?
questions.explanation: Jacob served Laban for seven years to marry Rachel.

questions.question: True or False: Jacob was deceived into marrying Leah before Rachel.
questions.explanation: Laban gave Leah to Jacob by night before he gave Rachel.

questions.question: How many sons did Jacob have?
questions.explanation: Jacob had twelve sons who became the tribes of Israel.

questions.question: What special coat did Joseph receive from his father Jacob?
questions.explanation: Jacob loved Joseph and gave him a coat of many colors.

questions.question: True or False: Joseph's brothers were jealous of him because of their father's favoritism.
questions.explanation: Joseph was loved more and his brothers hated him for it.

questions.question: What dreams did Joseph have that angered his brothers?
options: Dreams where his brothers' sheaves bowed to his sheaf and the sun, moon, and stars bowed to him
Dreams of becoming king of Egypt
questions.correctAnswer: Dreams where his brothers' sheaves bowed to his sheaf and the sun, moon, and stars bowed to him
questions.explanation: Joseph dreamed that his family would bow down to him, increasing their hatred.

questions.question: Who sold Joseph into slavery?
questions.explanation: Joseph's brothers sold him to Midianite traders.

questions.question: True or False: Joseph was taken to Egypt after being sold by his brothers.
questions.explanation: Joseph was sold to Midianites who took him to Egypt.

questions.question: Complete this verse: 'In the beginning God created the ____ and the earth.'
questions.explanation: The verse states God created the heaven and the earth.

questions.question: Complete this verse: 'And God said, Let us make man in our ____ , after our likeness.'
questions.explanation: God created man in His image and likeness.

questions.question: Complete this verse: 'And the LORD said unto Abram, After that Lot was separated from thee, Lift up now thine eyes, and look from the place where thou art ____ , and southward, and eastward, and westward.'
questions.explanation: God told Abram to look northward and in all directions.
